conbody.p:
File Tail originnodesFile Tail provides two nodes to connect to the rest of the pipeline:
Output Node Passes records read from the origin.
Metadata Node Passes information generated about file processing. If you do not require this information, connect the metadata node to the Trash destination. To retain this information for review, connect the metadata node any other destination or route the data as necessary. File processing metadata includes the following fields:
fileName - Name of the file.
inode - Index information for the file.
time - Time that the event occurred.
event - Processing event. START indicates that File Tail started processing the specified file. END indicates that File Tail completed processing the contents of the file.
File names can change when a server renames archived files. When this occurs, inode most reliably identifies a file.
